entry.title: A Proud Boy Got Stabbed In The Face In A Prison Fight Over Tucker Carlson
entry.description: A Proud Boy got stabbed in the nose in a prison fight that broke out while inmates were watching Tucker Carlson.

entry.title: House Republicans Strike Out As The Secret Service Doesn’t Keep Visitor Logs For Any President’s Private Home
entry.description: House Republicans want the visitor logs for President Biden's private home, but the Secret Service doesn't keep such records.

entry.title: Delusional Marjorie Taylor Greene Vows That House Republicans Will Deliver God’s Vengeance
entry.description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene is declaring that House Republicans will deliver God's vengeance to the nation.

entry.title: Biden Rips House Republicans For National Sales Tax Bill
entry.description: During his MLK Day address, President Biden laid into House Republicans for their plan to pass a bill imposing a national sales tax.

entry.title: It Looks Like The Russians Are Illegally Bankrolling George Santos
entry.description: A new report connects Rep. George Santos to a Russian oligarch who gave the congressman at least hundreds of thousands of dollars.

entry.title: Opinion: Amid GOP Drama Democrats Need To Flip The Script On Inflation
entry.description: We need to flip the script so expert economists’ first instinct isn’t to attack workers, where the pain will be felt the most, but rather to legislate limitations on corporations

entry.title: Chuck Schumer Turns The Tables On Republicans Who Are Blocking Biden’s FAA Nominee
entry.description: Senate Republicans have been complaining about problems with the nation's air travel system, but they have been blocking Biden's nominee to run the FAA since March of 2022.

entry.title: Jamie Raskin Shatters The GOP Argument On Biden Classified Docs With 1 Point
entry.description: Rep. Jamie Raskin (D-MD) wrecked the GOP argument on Biden and classified documents by pointing out that President Biden isn't an insurrectionist who tried to overthrow the government.

entry.title: Adam Schiff Blasts House GOP Hypocrites On Biden Classified Docs
entry.description: Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA) said that House Republicans are hypocrites for wanting to investigate the Biden classified docs while ignoring Trump's potential classified docs crimes.

entry.title: Trump Appears To Be Terrified Of Special Counsel Jack Smith
entry.description: Donald Trump has increasingly been attacking Special Counsel Jack Smith, which suggests that the ex-president is scared.

entry.title: What the House Drama Reveals about the State of Extremism in America
entry.description: The gang of extremists, who controlled the process of deciding the Speaker, did not so much elect McCarthy as much as they tamed, domesticated, and subordinated him.

entry.title: The New York Times Show Its True Colors By Giving A Platform To Kellyanne Conway
entry.description: The New York Times showed that it is all in on its mission to restore Trump to the White House by giving a platform to unemployable Trump liar Kellyanne Conway.

entry.title: Outraged George Santos Constituents Promise To Make His Life A Nightmare Until He Resigns
entry.description: Constituents gathered outside of the alleged Queens, NY office of Rep. George Santos (R-NY) and promised to make his life a nightmare until he resigns.

entry.title: President Biden To Deliver The State Of The Union On February 7
entry.description: Speaker of the House Kevin McCarthy has invited President Biden to deliver the State Of The Union Address on February 7, 2023.

entry.title: Trump’s 2024 Campaign Is Bombing And Struggling To Raise Money
entry.description:
The money isn’t coming into Trump’s 2024 presidential campaign, as his decision to announce an early bid has bombed. Gabriel Sherman at Vanity Fair reported: There are several theories about why Trump’s campaign has been so underwhelming out of the gate. “Money is a real issue,” the former administration official said. Already, prominent GOP mega-donors, …

Continue reading "Trump’s 2024 Campaign Is Bombing And Struggling To Raise Money"

entry.title: House Democrats Are Going To Cause Chaos By Trying To Get McCarthy Removed As Speaker
entry.description:
House Democrats and progressives are getting set to give Kevin McCarthy constant headaches by filing motions to remove him as speaker. Politico reported: “Why not? You know, that sounds like a good idea. I mean, you’re still going to need what, 218 for passage, right? But listen, man, he has a very slim majority,” mused …

Continue reading "House Democrats Are Going To Cause Chaos By Trying To Get McCarthy Removed As Speaker"

entry.title: Merrick Garland Shuts Republicans Down By Appointing Biden Classified Documents Special Counsel
entry.description:
Attorney General Garland announced that Robert Hur would act as special counsel to investigate Biden’s handling of classified documents. Video of Garland: Attorney General Garland said: The document authorizes him to investigate whether a person or entity violated the law in connection with this matter. The special counsel will not be subject to the day-to-day …

Continue reading "Merrick Garland Shuts Republicans Down By Appointing Biden Classified Documents Special Counsel"

entry.title: Republicans Are Wrong To Call For A Special Counsel To Investigate Biden Classified Docs
entry.description: Republicans, like Sen. Josh Hawley (R-MO), continue to intentionally miss the point that the Biden and Trump classified document situations are not the same thing.

entry.title: Chuck Schumer Tells House Republicans Their Anti-Abortion Bills Are Doomed
entry.description: As House Republicans get set to vote on two anti-abortion bills, Democratic Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer told them that their bills are doomed in the Senate.

entry.title: Hakeem Jeffries Renames Jim Jordan’s Select Committee The Committee On Insurrection Protection
entry.description: On the House floor, Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-NY) renamed Jim Jordan's select committee the committee on insurrection protection.

entry.title: George Santos’s Local Republican Party Tells Him To Immediately Resign
entry.description: The Nassau County Republican Party called on Rep. George Santos (R-NY) to resign for lying to the district's voters.

entry.title: C-SPAN Just Called Kevin McCarthy’s Transparency Bluff
entry.description: Speaker Kevin McCarthy's new House rules call for more transparency, so C-SPAN sent a letter to McCarthy asking him to allow more cameras in the House.

entry.title: Jen Psaki Gives An Inside Look At Biden’s Classified Docs Strategy
entry.description: On MSNBC, Jen Psaki discussed why the Biden White House is playing it by the book on the classified documents they turned over to the National Archives.

entry.description: Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA) took to the House floor to expose Rep. Jim Jordan's (R-OH) select subcommittee for being a cover-up operation.

entry.title: Katie Porter Gets A Jump On Other Democratic Candidates By Announcing 2024 Senate Run
entry.description: Even though Sen. Dianne Feinstein (D-CA) has not announced her retirement yet, Rep. Katie Porter launched her campaign for the 2024 California Senate race.

entry.description: Participation in traditional houses of worship is in decline, but innovation and growth are happening elsewhere.

entry.title: How Americans’ Support For Aiding Ukraine Has Evolved
entry.description: Welcome to Pollapalooza, our weekly polling roundup. Last Friday, in collaboration with European allies, President Biden announced a new $3 billion military assistance package to Ukraine, the latest in what has been a steady stream of American military, economic and humanitarian assistance since Russia invaded. The aid has been met with praise from the Ukrainian […]

entry.title: What Will New Leadership In Congress Mean For Democrats?
entry.description: House Democrats officially elected New York Rep. Hakeem Jeffries to be their leader this past weekend, coalescing around a fresher face as the new Republican majority took control. The new top three leaders will consist of Jeffries, Massachusetts Rep. Katherine Clark, who will serve as the new minority whip, and California Rep. Pete Aguilar, who […]

entry.title: DeSantis Is Polling Well Against Trump — As Long As No One Else Runs
entry.description: I’m not happy about it, and you’re not happy about it, but it’s time to talk about polls of the 2024 Republican presidential primary. We’re still (probably) more than a year away from the Iowa caucuses, yet pollsters have already asked about the Republican primary at least 96 times since the 2022 midterm elections.  Yes, […]

entry.title: Kevin McCarthy Is Speaker, But He’s Got A Tough Job Ahead
entry.description: Last week, internal Republican Party divisions spilled onto the floor of the House of Representatives in a way rarely publicly seen in Washington. In this installment of the FiveThirtyEight Politics podcast, the crew looks at why it took 15 votes to get Rep. Kevin McCarthy elected House Speaker and what that process says about the […]

entry.title: Rents Are Still Higher Than Before The Pandemic — And Assistance Programs Are Drying Up
entry.description: Cleveland is one of the poorest cities in the country. It’s far from the expensive coastal cities like New York City and San Francisco, where astronomically high rents are common. Cleveland doesn’t fit the stereotype of a city people want to move to; in fact, it has been losing population since the 1950s. But since […]

entry.title: Kevin McCarthy’s Job Just Got Harder
entry.description: If Rep. Kevin McCarthy didn’t have a lucky number before, it’s surely 15 now. Just after midnight on Saturday morning, the House of Representatives finally voted to make McCarthy speaker of the House on the 15th ballot — the resolution of an historic, multi-day staredown with conservative hardliners who will now wield tremendous power in […]

entry.title: Kevin McCarthy Doesn’t Have Enough Fans Inside The House … Or Outside It
entry.description: Welcome to Pollapalooza, our weekly polling roundup. Many of us at FiveThirtyEight have been glued to C-SPAN this week, as we’ve watched the yet-to-be-sworn-in House repeatedly try — and fail — to elect a speaker. With a slim majority in the chamber, Republicans were held hostage by a far-right flank of the party that refused […]

entry.title: 3 Questions We Have About George Santos
entry.description: Before the revelations, George Santos was the type of fresh face the Republican Party would have put front and center. The representative-elect is Latino, openly gay and just 34 years old. And by winning the election in New York’s 3rd Congressional District last year, he appeared to have cracked the code to succeeding as a […]

entry.title: What The 20 Republicans Who Voted Against Kevin McCarthy Have In Common
entry.description: The 20 Republicans who opposed Kevin McCarthy’s bid for speaker of the House had something in common before Tuesday’s drama: They are very conservative and scorn the Republican Party establishment. As you probably know by now, the 118th Congress began on Tuesday, and the election for speaker of the House — usually a mere formality […]

entry.title: Why ‘Kidfluencers’ Have So Few Protections — Even As Americans Support Regulating The Industry
entry.description: “Kidfluencers” — children whose social media presence is followed and monetized — are a notable part of the growing business of social media. But this industry lacks protections for the children whose personalities and poses rake in an ever-growing amount of clicks and dollars.  Since their inception, social media sites have largely evaded regulation. Even […]

entry.title: Do You Buy That … Young Voters Handed Democrats Wins In Close Races?
entry.description: FiveThirtyEight’s Nate Silver considers the impact young voters had on the midterm election results on “This Week.”

entry.title: How Biden Could Appoint More Judges Than Trump
entry.description: Democrats now have a slightly bigger Senate majority but not much to do with it. And so, it’s time for more judges. Retaining the Senate means that President Biden and Senate Democrats will be able to continue nominating and confirming federal judges, and, if they play their cards right over the next two years, Democrats […]

entry.title: The Numbers That Defined 2022
entry.description: What a year 2022 has been. There was so … much … news. We saw record-high inflation, war in Ukraine, a landmark Supreme Court session, continuing effects of the pandemic, the Winter Olympics, the death of Queen Elizabeth II, the World Cup and, of course, the midterms. In typical FiveThirtyEight fashion, we’ve been reflecting on […]

entry.title: The Number That Will Shape Republican Politics In 2023
entry.description: This video is part of our series “The Numbers That Defined 2022.” Transcript Maya Sweedler: One of the most important numbers coming out of 2022 is nine. That’s the difference between the number of seats Republicans won in the U.S. House of Representatives in November and the number of seats Democrats won. If you’re thinking, […]

entry.title: How 2022 Was A Win For Democracy
entry.description: A few weeks before the midterms, I attended an election-denying group’s Zoom meeting. There had been alarming reports of a massive, well-funded campaign to place election deniers in voting centers that could cause havoc on Election Day. I wanted to know exactly what these groups were telling these volunteers, so I found one in Pennsylvania […]

entry.title: What I Got Wrong In 2022
entry.description: Here’s a prediction that 100 percent, absolutely, positively will come true: I will get something wrong in 2023. Here at FiveThirtyEight, we make a lot of predictions every year; some of them work out, but we can’t get every single one right.  We can, however, learn from our mistakes. That’s why I like to write […]

entry.title: How Inflation’s 41-Year High Impacted American Life
entry.description: This video is part of our series “The Numbers That Defined 2022.” Transcript Monica Potts: One of the most important numbers of 2022 was 9.1 percent. That was the inflation rate in June — the highest yearly increase since 1981. Inflation affected all Americans, but its severity varied by region. And as you might expect, […]

entry.title: The EPA Is Finally Addressing 4 Dangerous ‘Forever Chemicals’ — Out Of Over 4,000
entry.description: This video is part of our series “The Numbers That Defined 2022.” Transcript Maggie Koerth: I have two important numbers for you this year. Some good news. And some bad news. First, there’s four … That’s the number of harmful per- and polyfluorinated chemicals, or PFAS, that the Environmental Protection Agency released new concentration guidelines […]

entry.title: When Might Other Republicans Challenge Trump For The 2024 Nomination?
entry.description: Last month, former President Donald Trump announced his campaign to return to the White House, more than a year before the start of the 2024 presidential primary process. So far, Trump is the only major Republican candidate who’s launched a bid. While his entry may deter some opponents from running, it’s unlikely Trump will have […]

entry.title: US lawmakers in Davos tell Europeans: America’s not protectionist
entry.description: They're trying to convince Brussels that Washington's subsidy push won't hurt European businesses.

entry.description: Belgian authorities believe Silvia Panzeri was fully aware of her father's activities, according to a warrant seen by POLITICO.

entry.title: UK’s Cleverly slams ‘shameful’ Iranian execution
entry.description: James Cleverly says Alireza Akbari 'fell victim to the political vendettas of a vicious regime' in Tehran.

entry.description: La Liga's Javier Tebas says an EU-wide approach is needed to preserve the Continent's sports model.

entry.description: The Brexiteer ex-leader previously wrote 'The Perils Of Pushy Parents.'

entry.title: Germany’s Baerbock proposes special tribunal to prosecute Russian leadership
entry.description: 'Putin must now know that his aggression will not remain without consequences,' foreign minister says.

entry.title: No breakthrough yet — but EU and UK to keep talking on Northern Ireland Brexit rules
entry.description: Two sides vow to continue Northern Ireland protocol talks in 'constructive and collaborative spirit.'

entry.title: UK’s foreign secretary James Cleverly ‘sanctioned by Russia’
entry.description: 'If this is the price for supporting Ukrainian freedom, then I’m happy to be sanctioned,' says UK's top diplomat.

entry.title: Chelsea FC’s signing of Ukrainian football star leads to cash for war effort
entry.description: Around €23M of Mykhailo Mudryk's transfer fee will be donated to Ukrainian soldiers and their families, his former club's president says.

entry.title: A Florida School Received a Threat. Did a Red Flag Law Prevent a Shooting?
entry.description: Judges in 19 states and the District of Columbia are issuing orders to keep guns out of the hands of people deemed dangerous, like a Fort Lauderdale teenager who threatened a school shooting.

entry.title: A Year After a Fiery Voting Rights Speech, Biden Delivers a More Muted Address
entry.description: On Martin Luther King Jr.’s birthday, the president assured an audience at Ebenezer Baptist Church that its side in the struggle would, indeed, overcome someday.

entry.title: White House Says It Does Not Keep Visitor Logs at Biden’s Delaware Home
entry.description: A top House Republican had demanded the logs after classified documents were found at President Biden’s personal residence.

entry.title: Liz Robbins Dies at 76; Broke Glass Ceiling as a Washington Lobbyist
entry.description: She founded the first woman-owned lobbying firm in the country, and made her name by supporting social policy and nonprofit causes.

entry.title: Missouri State Lawmakers Revise Their Dress Code for Women
entry.description: The updated dress code requires female legislators and staff members in the State House of Representatives to wear a jacket, such as a blazer or a cardigan.

entry.title: Biden’s Goals on Northern Ireland Present Challenges for Sunak
entry.description: The American president wants Britain’s squabble with Europe over Northern Ireland trade issues settled before the 25th anniversary of the peace accord that ended sectarian violence in the North.

entry.title: Hand Recount of 2020 Election Results in Lycoming County Showed Little Change
entry.description: Lycoming County, Pa., officials were persuaded to conduct a 2020 recount, a three-day undertaking that showed almost no change, but left skeptics just as skeptical.

entry.title: Documents Inquiry Puts Spotlight on Biden’s Frenetic Last Days as Vice President
entry.description: The special counsel will have to reconstruct how a small number of classified documents made it to Mr. Biden’s home in Delaware and a private office in Washington.

entry.title: Biden Administration Faces Resistance to Plan to Sell F-16s to Turkey
entry.description: The State Department has contacted Congress about major arms deals for Turkey and Greece, but a prominent senator is strongly opposed to the Ankara sale.

entry.title: E. Jean Carroll’s Lawsuit Accusing Trump of Rape Can Proceed, Judge Rules
entry.description: In allowing E. Jean Carroll’s lawsuit to move forward, Judge Lewis Kaplan upheld the legality of New York’s Adult Survivors Act.

entry.title: Biden Will Deliver State of the Union Address on Feb. 7
entry.description: President Biden’s speech will be his first appearance before a House led by Republicans who are unlikely to cooperate with his agenda.

entry.title: Justice Dept. Cracks Down on Firearm Accessories in Bid to Bolster Gun Safety
entry.description: A final rule will require gun owners to apply for a permit within 120 days to use the accessories known as stabilizing braces.

entry.title: How Classified Information Is Handled
entry.description: Presidents have established and developed the classification system through a series of executive orders around World War II and the early Cold War.

entry.title: Russell Pearce, Fiery Foe of Illegal Immigration, Dies at 75
entry.description: As an Arizona state senator, he sponsored what came to be known as the “show me your papers” law, requiring the police to demand documentation from those they detained.

entry.title: The History of Presidents and Special Prosecutors
entry.description: Since the dark days of Watergate, every president but one has faced a special prosecutor scrutinizing them or their associates. President Biden now joins the club.

entry.title: David Kessler, Leader of Biden’s Covid Vaccine Effort, Is Stepping Down
entry.description: Dr. David A. Kessler took over Operation Warp Speed when President Biden entered office, and his departure signals the end of the program.

entry.title: Who Are the Proud Boys on Trial for Seditious Conspiracy?
entry.description: The five defendants are members of one of the nation’s best-known far-right groups and are accused of helping to lead the assault on the Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021.

entry.title: Bob Jordan, Southwest Airlines’ CEO, on What Went Wrong
entry.description: Southwest Airlines’ chief executive, Bob Jordan, said frigid temperatures and mistakes by the company caused its meltdown around Christmas.

entry.title: U.S. Will Hit Debt Limit on Thursday, Yellen Tells Congress
entry.description: The Treasury Department expects to begin taking “extraordinary measures” to continue paying the government’s obligations before what is expected to be a big fight to raise the borrowing cap.

entry.title: Biden and Kishida Vow to Bolster US-Japan Alliance as China’s Power Grows
entry.description: The two leaders discussed tensions with China, North Korea and Russia and plans for deterrence in Asia with U.S. troops and missiles.

entry.title: Did Aliens Land on Earth in 1945? A Defense Bill Seeks Answers.
entry.description: The Defense Department’s annual spending bill requires it to review U.F.O. sightings dating to 1945, the year some believe an object from space crashed in the New Mexico desert.

entry.title: European Parliament Focuses on 2 More Lawmakers in Corruption Scandal
entry.description: The assembly on Monday began the process of lifting the immunity of two members at the request of the Belgian police in a snowballing corruption investigation involving Qatar.

entry.title: UK Confirms Plan to Send Tanks to Ukraine
entry.description: The U.K. defense secretary said specialty guns, ammunition, drones and other equipment were also part of the package being sent to Ukraine.

entry.title: U.K. Government Blocks Scottish Law Making Gender Change Easier
entry.description: For the first time, the government in London is blocking legislation approved by the Scottish Parliament, saying the measure on gender identity would undermine U.K.-wide equality law.

entry.title: U.N. Confirms More Than 7,000 Civilian Deaths in Ukraine
entry.description: The total includes only those that U.N. investigators have been able to corroborate, and does not include the dozens killed in Saturday’s strike on Dnipro.

entry.title: Fox Sports Could Be Focus of FIFA Trial in Brooklyn
entry.description: Two former executives are accused of paying bribes to obtain broadcast rights, including for the World Cup. Testimony could reveal what the company knew.

entry.title: London Police Officer Admits to 49 Charges of Sexual Abuse, Including Rape
entry.description: David Carrick, who worked for the Metropolitan Police, carried out “a relentless campaign” of violence over 17 years, prosecutors said, using his position of authority to manipulate victims.

entry.title: Christine Lambrecht Resigns as Germany’s Defense Minister
entry.description: Christine Lambrecht was a frequent target of criticism, including over German caution on military aid to Ukraine. Chancellor Olaf Scholz had backed her strongly, and may find her hard to replace.

entry.title: A united Europe weathers crises, but deeper challenges remain.
Russia is pulling off the biggest art heist since the Nazis in World War II, experts say.
Gina Lollobrigida, Movie Star and Sex Symbol, Is Dead at 95
entry.description: She began her career in her native Italy and, although she achieved fame in America worked more often in Europe. She later had a second career as an artist and filmmaker.

entry.title: Matteo Messina Denaro, Italian Mafia Boss, Is Arrested
entry.description: Matteo Messina Denaro, who was sentenced in absentia for the 1992 murders of two prosecutors and other crimes, was apprehended at a Sicilian hospital.

entry.title: The war in Ukraine upended energy markets. What does that mean for the climate?
entry.description: Almost a year after Russia launched its invasion, assessing the impact on the oil industry and greenhouse gas goals is not so simple.

entry.title: What 70 Years of War Can Tell Us About the Russia-Ukraine Conflict
entry.description: Despite some postmodern features, the fighting resembles a type of conflict from decades past: wars fought between nations in which one does not conquer the other outright.

entry.title: Germany’s defense minister resigns after criticism over her handling of the war.
entry.description: The minister was repeatedly attacked over public blunders and her handling of the war in Ukraine. She is the most senior member of Olaf Scholz’s government to resign.

entry.title: Britain leads a push for more Western military aid to Ukraine, and soon.
Your Monday Briefing
entry.description: A search for survivors after a Russian strike on a residential building.

entry.title: In Swiss Alps, Some Wonder What a Future Without Snow May Mean
entry.description: An unusually warm winter has forced a rethink about climate change in areas with lower peaks as ski resorts and sporting events face an uncertain future.

entry.title: When Being European Parliament President Includes Aiding Police Raids
entry.description: Roberta Metsola, the youngest person to become president of the European Parliament, is seeking to expand the assembly’s role while guiding it through the aftermath of major bribery accusations.

entry.title: Biden’s Goals on Northern Ireland Present Challenges for Sunak
entry.description: The American president wants Britain’s squabble with Europe over Northern Ireland trade issues settled before the 25th anniversary of the peace accord that ended sectarian violence in the North.

entry.title: Dead, Alive or Devastated After Russian Strike on Apartments
entry.description: Rescue workers were still digging through the ruins of a residential building in the central Ukrainian city of Dnipro on Sunday, a day after a Russian missile attack.

entry.title: Armed Insurgents Kidnap 50 Women in Burkina Faso
entry.description: The women were abducted while searching for food in a region that has been under a blockade by extremist groups for nearly a year.

entry.title: Greek Court Drops Espionage Charges Against Aid Workers
entry.description: The 24 defendants had been charged with misdemeanors over their work with migrants, but they still face more serious charges.

entry.title: ‘A Wild Card’: Son of Uganda’s President Jostles to Succeed His Father
entry.description: Gen. Muhoozi Kainerugaba has been positioning himself as Uganda’s next leader. But his provocative tweets have unnerved Ugandans and put his father in a bind.

entry.title: Uganda’s Worst Ebola Outbreak in Two Decades Is Over, W.H.O. Declares
entry.description: The virus spread to nine districts nationwide, infecting hundreds and killing dozens. Seven health workers were among those who died.

entry.title: Bus Crash in Senegal Kills at Least 40
entry.description: The president of the West African country announced three days of national mourning for the victims.

entry.title: A Vibrant Nightlife Scene Booms in South Africa’s Townships
entry.description: Clubs in Khayelitsha, the nation’s second largest township, are attracting Black professionals with entertainment that “we love, we want.”

entry.title: African Journalists Urge Senegal to Release Pape Alé Niang
entry.description: Pape Alé Niang, an investigative reporter, was arrested on charges of disclosing confidential government information. Journalists and rights defenders say he was just doing his job.

entry.title: Mali Pardons Detained Ivorian Soldiers
entry.description: Ivory Coast had said the 49 soldiers were in Mali to provide security for a United Nations peacekeeping mission, but Mali had accused them of being mercenaries.

entry.title: Kenyan Gay Rights Activist, Edwin Chiloba, Is Killed
entry.description: Edwin Chiloba’s body was dumped on the roadside by a moving vehicle in the country’s west. Police have arrested his friend and are pursuing two others in the case.

entry.title: She Is Africa’s First Heat Officer. Can She Make Her City Livable?
entry.description: Eugenia Kargbo remembers when Sierra Leone’s capital was greener and cooler, and is now trying to help the city combat rising temperatures.

entry.title: Twin Car Explosions Kill More than 20 in Somalia
entry.description: A terrorist group, Al Shabab, claimed responsibility for the attacks, which came as the militants lose control of towns and villages to a government offensive.

entry.title: The Cheetahs Made a Kill. Then the Safari Trucks Swarmed In.
entry.description: A video showing dozens of vehicles moving in on a pair of big cats in a Kenyan game reserve highlights how “aggressive tourism” can put endangered animals at even greater risk.

entry.title: Dakar Street Style: A Photo Portfolio
entry.description: The capital of Senegal has become a fashion center. But photographing stylish people going about their day isn’t as easy as clicking a button.

entry.title: How Russia’s War on Ukraine Is Worsening Global Starvation
entry.description: Moscow blocks most shipments from Ukraine, one of the world’s largest wheat producers, and its attacks on the country’s energy grid also disrupt the flow of food.

entry.title: They Said They Went to Mali to Keep the Peace. Now They’re Jailed as Mercenaries.
entry.description: Ivory Coast said its soldiers were in Mali to provide security for the United Nations peacekeeping mission. But Mali accused them of seeking to undermine its own security.

entry.title: Algeria Cracks Down on Last Remaining Independent Media Outlet
entry.description: The country has effectively closed down one of the last places in Algeria for freewheeling political debate, which carried on even as the military-backed regime that leads the country grew increasingly authoritarian.

entry.title: Book Review: ‘House of Bondage,’ by Ernest Cole
entry.description: In a newly reissued photo book from 1967, Ernest Cole surveys the ever-present atrocities of European oppression.

entry.title: White Men Charged in Attack on Black Teenagers at Pool in South Africa
entry.description: Two youths who tried to use a pool at a resort on Christmas Day said they were told it was for “white people only.” The violent encounter led to a charge of attempted murder and a call by the president to battle racism.

entry.title: Day 27: What Are Kids Saying About Kwanzaa?
entry.description: As some Black families celebrate Kwanzaa this week, we asked children to share their impressions of this nonreligious holiday honoring African American culture.

entry.title: Nets, Buoys, Salt, Ice. For West African Fishermen, ‘Everything’ Is Going Up.
entry.description: Fishermen in Sierra Leone need large amounts of ice to store their catch on multiday journeys. Like many commodities, it has become pricey.

entry.title: Former Afghan Lawmaker Shot Dead at Her Home in Kabul
entry.description: The legislator, Mursal Nabizada, was one of a few female parliamentarians who remained in the country after the Western-backed government collapsed and the Taliban seized power.

entry.title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Chinese ‘Zero Covid’ Workers Revolt
In Nepal Crash, Pilot Met the Same Fate as Her Husband 17 Years Before
entry.description: Anju Khatiwada, who died on Sunday in a crash in Pokhara, Nepal, decided to become a pilot after her husband’s death in 2006. The family’s calamities are part of a deadly pattern of aviation disasters in Nepal.

entry.title: Covid Workers in China Clash With Police Over Unpaid Wages, Layoffs
entry.description: Companies that reaped windfalls helping the government implement strict ‘zero Covid’ controls are now struggling to pay and keep workers.

entry.title: Your Monday Briefing: A Fatal Plane Crash in Nepal
entry.description: Also a major attack in Ukraine, Japan’s military ambitions and a preview of the Australian Open.

entry.title: At Least 68 Dead After Plane Crashes in Nepal
entry.description: A twin-engine propeller plane crashed on approach to the city of Pokhara, with 72 people on board.

entry.title: ‘I’m Sorry, We’re From Moscow.’ In Bali, Warring Sides Learn to Cohabitate
entry.description: Thousands of Russians and Ukrainians have fled their homelands for Bali. But even in a tropical paradise, the war is ever-present.

entry.title: China Reports Nearly 60,000 Covid-Linked Deaths Since Lifting Restrictions
entry.description: The unexpected disclosure was made as the country faces mounting criticism for providing unreliable data on its latest coronavirus outbreak.

entry.title: As Russians Steal Ukraine’s Art, They Attack Its Identity, Too
entry.description: Russian forces have looted tens of thousands of pieces, including avant-garde oil paintings and Scythian gold. Experts say it is the biggest art heist since the Nazis in World War II, intended to strip Ukraine of its cultural heritage.

entry.title: Biden and Kishida Vow to Bolster US-Japan Alliance as China’s Power Grows
entry.description: The two leaders discussed tensions with China, North Korea and Russia and plans for deterrence in Asia with U.S. troops and missiles.

entry.title: Investigation Blames Negligence, Poor Planning for Seoul Crowd Crush
entry.description: Investigators want 23 people indicted but cleared senior authorities of fault in the Halloween tragedy. Victims’ families disputed the inquiry’s findings.

entry.title: She Witnessed Mao’s Worst Excesses. Now She Has a Warning for the World.
entry.description: At 93, the memoirist Yuan-tsung Chen hopes that her recollections of China’s tumultuous past will help the country confront its historical wrongs — and avoid repeating them.

entry.title: Afghan Women Are Devastated by Suspension of Aid Under New Taliban Law
entry.description: Since the Taliban administration banned women from aid work, many groups have suspended their operations in the country and warned of permanently shutting down if the ban remains.

entry.title: Your Friday Briefing: Investigating Chinese Police Outposts Abroad
entry.description: Also, Xi Jinping changes his tone on business and South Korea considers nuclear weapons.

entry.title: Sri Lanka’s Former President Ordered to Pay Compensation Over 2019 Bombings
entry.description: A Supreme Court ruling denounced former President Maithripala Sirisena and some of his top officials for what it called “reckless failure” to prevent the attacks, which killed more than 200 people.

entry.title: Why China Is Changing Its Tone on Business
entry.description: With the economy in a fragile state, Chinese officials are starting to use more business-friendly language, and also to back their words with action.

entry.title: In a First, South Korea Declares Nuclear Weapons a Policy Option
entry.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol said that if North Korea’s nuclear threat grows, his country may build a nuclear arsenal of its own or ask the United States to redeploy in the South.​

entry.title: Driver in Guangzhou, China, Runs Down Pedestrians, Killing at Least 5
entry.description: The police in Guangzhou detained a 22-year-old man, who appeared to throw money in the air after striking the people. Thirteen people were injured.

entry.title: U.S. and Japan Say They Will Strengthen Military Cooperation
entry.description: Top officials from the two nations are meeting in Washington this week to discuss tensions with China, Russia and North Korea and to plan for deterrence with U.S. troops and missiles.

entry.title: Your Thursday Briefing: A Russian Military Shake-Up
entry.description: Also, Brazil investigates the riots and Australia reacts to Cardinal George Pell’s death.

entry.title: Why This Trilobite Had Neptune’s Trident for a Nose
entry.description: A new paper suggests an ancient creature’s odd anatomical feature may be the earliest known example of specialized sexual combat in the animal kingdom.

entry.title: Hamas Releases Video That Appears to Show Israeli Missing Since 2014
entry.description: If verified as authentic, the footage would provide the first public proof of life of Avera Mengistu, an Israeli citizen who disappeared after walking into Gaza and had been held captive by Hamas.

entry.title: Britain Says It Will Give Ukraine Tanks, Breaching a Western Taboo
entry.description: Western countries have balked at giving Ukraine tanks and other powerful weapons. As increased spring fighting looms, that seems to be changing.

entry.title: Thousands in Israel Protest Netanyahu’s Plans to Limit Courts
entry.description: The right-wing government’s proposals for sweeping judicial reform are viewed by critics as anti-democratic and have galvanized the opposition.

entry.title: Cooperation on Climate Is Emerging in the Middle East
entry.description: After the Abraham Accords, partnerships between companies in Israel and Arab countries have led to the kinds of initiatives that will be on the Davos agenda.

entry.title: Iran Executes Alireza Akbari, Ex-Official Accused of Spying
entry.description: Alireza Akbari, previously a senior military and defense official, had moved to Britain a decade ago. He had been detained since 2019.

entry.title: Greek Court Drops Espionage Charges Against Aid Workers
entry.description: The 24 defendants had been charged with misdemeanors over their work with migrants, but they still face more serious charges.

entry.title: Netanyahu’s Judicial Overhaul Proposal Sets Off Fury in Israel
entry.description: A proposal to weaken the Supreme Court has set off an early backlash against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s new hard-right government.

entry.title: Iran Gives Death Sentence to Former Defense Official, a Dual U.K. Citizen
entry.description: Alireza Akbari, a former deputy defense minister, was convicted of spying, in a case he described as a slap at Britain, where he had lived.

entry.title: In Israel, Netanyahu’s Hard-Right Agenda Gains Steam
entry.description: Benjamin Netanyahu’s government is pushing to upend the judiciary, entrench Israeli control of the West Bank and strengthen ultraconservative Jews, fueling protests and deepening Israel’s divisions.

entry.title: With the Return of Netanyahu in Israel, His Family Is Back, Too
entry.description: Many Israelis fear that with Benjamin Netanyahu’s return to power at the head of Israel’s most right-wing government, his family members will play an outsize role in his decision making.

entry.title: In Power With Netanyahu, Ultra-Orthodox Parties Chart Israel’s Future
entry.description: Bolstered by growth in numbers and political influence, ultra-Orthodox parties are pushing for greater autonomy, with potentially far-reaching implications for the country.

entry.title: Iran Executes 2 Men Arrested in Protests
entry.description: At least nine other protesters remain on death row, accused of crimes ranging from burning a trash can to killing security forces.

entry.title: Iran Protests: People Executed or Sentenced to Death in Crackdown
entry.description: An updated look at the Iranians who have been hanged, and those on death row, as the government tries to crush a monthslong uprising.

entry.title: U.S. Officials Repatriate a Looted Relic to the Palestinian Authority
entry.description: As the object, a carved spoon, was handed back at a ceremony in Bethlehem, officials said it was the first time the United States had repatriated an antiquity to the Palestinian government.

entry.title: For the State Department, Now It’s Türkiye, Not Turkey
entry.description: The department will use the Turkish-language spelling in “most formal, diplomatic, and bilateral contexts” after a request from the country’s embassy, a spokesman said.

entry.title: Actress Detained for Supporting Iranian Protests Is Released on Bail
entry.description: Taraneh Alidoosti, one of the most high-profile targets in Iran’s campaign against celebrities who have expressed solidarity with the demonstrators, was arrested on Dec. 18.

entry.title: In a Hospital Ward, the Wounds of Tunisia’s Failed Democracy Don’t Heal
entry.description: Tunisia’s road to democracy began with a self-immolation, and such cases have filled hospital burn wards ever since, as elected leaders failed to deliver on a promise of prosperity.

entry.title: Hard-Line Israeli Minister Visits Volatile Jerusalem Holy Site
entry.description: Itamar Ben-Gvir, the ultranationalist national security minister, toured the site just days after taking office, drawing a furious reaction from Palestinian leaders.

entry.title: Dubai Suspends Alcohol Tax as Regional Competition Heats Up
entry.description: Lower-cost liquor could help the emirate keep its edge over neighbors like Saudi Arabia and Qatar as the Middle East’s hub for leisure and business.

entry.title: 'Skeletonized' human remains were found on UC Berkeley's campus
entry.description: The University of California Police Department has opened an investigation after a human skeleton was found on the UC Berkeley campus, officials say.

entry.title: Dallas Zoo monkey enclosure fencing was cut on the same day as tampering that allowed a leopard to escape, police say
entry.description: Fencing that was cut at the Dallas Zoo's clouded leopard habitat Friday -- resulting in the escape of one of the animals -- wasn't the only apparent tampering at the zoo that day, police said.

entry.title: Bills will face Bengals for 1st time since Damar Hamlin's on-field collapse
entry.description: The Buffalo Bills are set to face the Cincinnati Bengals next week for the first time since Bills safety Damar Hamlin's on-field collapse brought a game between the two teams to a halt and set off a national outpouring of support.

entry.title: New York man who broke into a school to shelter more than 20 people from deadly blizzard is awarded Super Bowl tickets by the Buffalo Bills
entry.description: A man who saved more than 20 people during the deadly snowstorm that shrouded Erie County, New York, in December has been thanked for his actions with tickets to the Super Bowl gifted to him in part by the NFL's Buffalo Bills.

entry.title: Biden's political trajectory has dramatically shifted in the span of just one week
entry.description: President Joe Biden began the new year with the political winds at his back.

entry.title: TikTok access from government devices now restricted in more than half of US states
entry.description: More than half of all US states have partially or fully banned TikTok from government devices, according to a CNN analysis, reflecting a wave of recent clampdowns by governors and state agencies targeting the short-form video app.

entry.title: White House counsel's office says there are no visitors logs at Biden's Wilmington home
entry.description: The White House counsel's office says there are no visitors logs that track guests who come and go at President Joe Biden's home in Wilmington, Delaware.

entry.title: Federal student loan office has lots to do but no new money to do it
entry.description: Big headaches for student loan borrowers could be on the horizon.

entry.title: The steep plunge in used car prices -- what it means, and what's ahead
entry.description: Tracking used car prices is enough to give anyone whiplash.

entry.title: Bitcoin rallies 25% as crypto markets rebound
entry.description: The bitcoin bulls are back.

entry.title: Why some cars from the 1990s are soaring in value
entry.description: Not that long ago, cars from the 1990s were just used cars. And, really, most of them still are, if they're still running at all. But as millenials get older, gain some disposable income, and pine for the cars of their own youth, many of these cars have crossed the threshold to becoming sought after collectibles with rising values in the car collecting world.

entry.title: Davos draws record crowds, but its relevance is fading
entry.description: Every year, business leaders, billionaires and politicians gather in Davos, Switzerland under the banner of forging ties that can help solve global problems.

entry.title: Family throws surprise birthday party at Eagles tailgate for Vietnam vet
$200,000 worth of supplies donated to PB schools
Car chase ends with police-involved shooting
Mother fends off raccoon from daughter
Cars totaling nearly $200k stolen from dealership
Christmas parade road closures and detours
Hospitals becoming a 'dumping ground' for kids
Girl who called 911 for her father honored
Water study could delay commercial construction
Almost 200 animals rescued from puppy mill
She made a promise to her husband to keep their tree farm going
HS football players gain perspective helping vets
Milwaukee Dancing Grannies planning return
Fire crews respond to fire at boarded up building
10-year-old shoot mom over VR headset
Condo owners remember building scare
5th grader raises $2,000 for grieving teacher
Mexico ready to retaliate by hurting US farmers
entry.description: Mexican Senator Armando Rios Piter told CNN that he plans to introduce a bill this week that would stop Mexican purchases of American corn.

entry.title: Will the next iPhone charge wirelessly?
entry.description: The days of plugging in an iPhone to charge won't last forever.

entry.title: How 'America First' could turn into to 'India First'
entry.description: Nandan Nilekani, co-founder of one of India's biggest outsourcing companies, says an H-1B visa crackdown would ultimately hurt the U.S.

entry.title: Swiss voters reject corporate tax overhaul
entry.description: Read full story for latest details.

entry.title: Stocks hit record again. Is Trump the reason?
entry.description: The market is at all-time highs and many say Trump is the reason. But stocks were rallying when investors thought Hillary Clinton would win. Janet Yellen and the Fed may deserve more of the credit for the market's move.

entry.title: Apple stock nears record high
entry.description: Apple stock is less than $1 away from its all-time high amid renewed optimism for the iPhone.

entry.title: America's NAFTA nemesis: Canada, not Mexico
entry.description: President-elect Donald Trump focuses his criticism of NAFTA on Mexico. But Canada and America have a rocky trade history too.

entry.title: Verizon's plan: Consumers win, investors lose
entry.description: Verizon has decided to bring back unlimited data plans. But while that's great for its subscribers, it's awful news for investors. It's another sign of how brutally competitive the telecom business is. And it's hurting Verizon's stock.

entry.title: Oil prices have doubled in a year. Here's why
entry.description: The price of crude oil has more than doubled over the past year after bottoming out at $26 per barrel in February 2016.

entry.title: Tesla will sell electric cars in the Middle East
entry.description: The automaker announced Monday that its first official venture in the oil-rich Middle East will be in the United Arab Emirates.

entry.title: Indian rival slams Uber's business model
entry.description: Uber's top rival in India has some unsolicited advice for the U.S. startup: Go local.

entry.title: Cook calls for campaign against fake news
entry.description: Apple CEO Tim Cook wants the tech industry to take action against "fake news" stories that are polluting the web.

entry.title: Trump brand takes another hit
entry.description: Sears Holdings, the company that owns retail stores Sears and Kmart, said this weekend that it would remove 31 Trump-branded items from its website.

entry.title: Cutting down trash with bamboo packaging
entry.description: Universal Biopack makes packaging that it sells to restaurants and manufacturers. But rather than plastic, it uses a mixture of bamboo and cassava.

entry.title: Nike stars champion 'Equality' in new ad
entry.description: Nike on Sunday launched a star-studded short film titled "Equality" that coincides with Black History Month.

entry.title: 'Lego Batman' producer, then Treasury sec?
entry.description: Treasury secretary pick Steven Mnuchin is an executive producer on Warner Bros.' "The Lego Batman Movie," which pulled in an estimated $55.6 million from U.S. audiences during its opening weekend.

entry.title: Are we heading for another Greek debt crisis?
entry.description: It may seem like a recurring nightmare, but Greece is in danger of running out of money again.

entry.title: Verizon is bringing back unlimited data
entry.description: Read full story for latest details.

entry.title: Visa crackdown puts these rural doctors at risk
entry.description: Read full story for latest details.

entry.title: Trump isn't killing the bull market. Here's why
entry.description: Read full story for latest details.

entry.description:

entry.title: Press release - EP TODAY
entry.description:
Monday, 18 January

entry.title: Press release - Press briefing on this week’s plenary session
entry.description:
The European Parliament’s spokesperson will hold a last-minute briefing on the 16-19 January plenary session today at 16.30.

Source : © European Union, 2023 - EP

entry.title: Article - 30 years of EU single market: benefits and challenges (infographics)
entry.description:
Over the past 30 years the single market has brought unity and opportunities to Europeans. MEPs believe it has to be adapted further to respond to current challenges.

Source : © European Union, 2023 - EP

entry.title: Press release - Press briefing on next week’s plenary session
entry.description:
Spokespersons for Parliament and for political groups will hold a briefing on the 16-19 January plenary session on Friday at 11.00, in Parliament’s Anna Politkovskaya press room.

Source : © European Union, 2023 - EP

entry.title: Article - Apply for the 2023 European Charlemagne Youth Prize
entry.description:
If you are aged 16 to 30 and working on a project with an EU dimension, apply for the 2023 Charlemagne Youth Prize and win funds to further develop your initiative.

Source : © European Union, 2023 - EP

entry.title: Press release - Europeans concerned by cost of living crisis and expect additional EU measures
entry.description:
The rising cost of living is the most pressing worry for 93% of Europeans, finds the latest European Parliament Eurobarometer survey, released today in full.

Source : © European Union, 2023 - EP

entry.title: Press release - Ceremony to commemorate President Sassoli, Wednesday at 12:00
entry.description:
One year after his passing, the European Parliament will hold a ceremony to remember late President David Sassoli.

Source : © European Union, 2023 - EP

entry.title: Article - Sweden takes over EU presidency: what do MEPs expect?
entry.description:
Sweden took the helm of the Council of the EU for the third time on 1 January. What do Swedish MEPs expect from the coming six months?

Source : © European Union, 2023 - EP

entry.title: Press release - EP President launches procedure for two waivers of immunity
entry.description:
President Metsola has launched an urgent procedure for the waiver of immunity of two Members of the European Parliament, following a request from the Belgian judicial authorities.

Source : © European Union, 2023 - EP

entry.title: Article - Quiz: how much do you know about the EU's single market?
entry.description:
The EU's single market allows goods, services, capital and people to move freely across EU countries. How much do you know about it? Take our quiz.

Source : © European Union, 2023 - EP

entry.title: Article - Coming up in 2023: renewables, digital transformation, migration
entry.description:
Renewable energy, the circular economy, migration and online security are all on Parliament’s agenda for 2023.

Source : © European Union, 2023 - EP

entry.title: Article - Season’s greetings from the European Parliament
entry.description:
It has been a difficult year, coping with the continued impact of the pandemic, Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, energy supply problems, soaring inflation and the cost of living crisis.

Source : © European Union, 2022 - EP

entry.title: Article - LUX Audience Award 2023: the five finalists
entry.description:
Discover the nominees for the 2023 LUX Audience Award.

Source : © European Union, 2023 - EP

entry.title: Press release - Climate change: Deal on a more ambitious Emissions Trading System (ETS)
entry.description:
On Saturday night, MEPs and EU governments agreed to reform the Emissions Trading System to further reduce industrial emissions and invest more in climate friendly technologies.
Committee on the Environment, Public Health and Food Safety

Source : © European Union, 2022 - EP

entry.title: Press release - Deal on establishing the Social Climate Fund to support the energy transition
entry.description:
On Saturday night, Parliament and Council reached a provisional agreement to set up a new fund to help vulnerable citizens most affected by energy and transport poverty.
Committee on Employment and Social Affairs
Committee on the Environment, Public Health and Food Safety

Source : © European Union, 2022 - EP

entry.title: Press release - Emissions Trading System/Social Climate Fund: Press conference by EP negotiators
entry.description:
Following the deals reached this weekend on the Emissions Trading System and Social Climate Fund, a press conference with lead MEPs is scheduled for Monday 19 December at 10.30.
Committee on the Environment, Public Health and Food Safety

Source : © European Union, 2022 - EP

entry.title: Press release - Corruption scandal: MEPs insist on reforms for transparency and accountability
entry.description:
Parliament has reacted to recent allegations with immediate changes and demands for measures to close loopholes in existing transparency rules.
Committee on Constitutional Affairs
Committee on Foreign Affairs
Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs
Special Committee on foreign interference in all democratic processes in the European Union, including disinformation (INGE 2)

entry.title: Press release - Asylum: deal on reception conditions for applicants to international protection
entry.description:
Registered asylum-applicants will be able to start working sooner and their integration prospects will improve, under a draft law agreed by Parliament and Council.
Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs

Source : © European Union, 2022 - EP

entry.title: Press release - EU long-term budget needs urgent revision to cope with current crises
entry.description:
MEPs push for a reform of the EU budget to respond more effectively to evolving needs, address funding gaps, and increase flexibility and crisis responsiveness.
Committee on Budgets

Source : © European Union, 2022 - EP

entry.title: Press release - Holodomor: Parliament recognises Soviet starvation of Ukrainians as genocide
entry.description:
MEPs deplore that 90 years after the Holodomor, Russia is again committing horrific crimes in Ukraine.
Committee on Foreign Affairs

Source : © European Union, 2022 - EP
